      • awaitForStatePredicate

        public void awaitForStatePredicate(Predicate<JobExecutionState> predicate,
                                   long timeoutMs)
                            throws InterruptedException,
                                   TimeoutException
        Waits till a predicate on getRunningState() becomes true or timeout is reached.
        Parameters:
        predicate - the predicate to evaluate. Note that even though the predicate is applied on the entire object, it will be evaluated only when the running state changes.
        timeoutMs - the number of milliseconds to wait for the predicate to become true; 0 means wait forever.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the waiting was interrupted
        TimeoutException - if we reached the timeout before the predicate was satisfied.
